premises: A predator is present or prey is abundant but not both at the same time
conclusions: If prey is not abundant, then a predator is present
incorrect conclusions: If a predator is present, then prey is abundant
If prey is abundant, then a predator is present

premises: A flower is red or a bee is pollinating but not both at the same time
conclusions: If a bee is not pollinating, then a flower is red
incorrect conclusions: If a flower is red, then a bee is pollinating
If a bee is pollinating, then a flower is red

premises: A leaf is green or chlorophyll is present but not both at the same time
conclusions: If chlorophyll is not present, then a leaf is green
incorrect conclusions: If a leaf is green, then chlorophyll is present
If chlorophyll is present, then a leaf is green
